title: Dennis Publishing
text: At Dennis I worked as a full stack developer performing drupal maintenance, development and design of Dennis Publishing websites including Den of Geek, The Week, Cyclist.co.uk, alphr.co.uk and more.

title: SapientNitro
text: I helped set up the front end on the bulk of a lot of pages for the new US site of dove.com. We used Sapient’s backbone based Unilever platform and worked closely with the designers to follow Dove’s strict design guidelines. I also worked as a consultant for the Lynx team in developing concepts for a new Lynx campaign, advising what was possible in HTML and developing concept animations to be used in later builds and client pitches.

title: Site Your Art
text: This is a project I have conceived, built, designed and developed on my own. It is a website for creatives (mostly actors) to set up their own online portfolio and website. Built on the Drupal platform.

title: The Crocodile
text: Working on a Drupal 8 website for a client called Waypoint. I was the sole developer on this site. I was provided with desktop designs but had to adapt them for mobile.

title: AKQA
text: Working on a web app for Nike for International Womens Week. The app was built in CQ5 and a lot of my involvement involved integration with a Nike login web service. A lot of work with Ajax requests (without jQuery) and local storage.

title: Media Monks
text: Assisting on the Guinness.com website. Site was built in backbone marionette. A lot of my involvement was working on accessibility and getting the site to work on older mobile devices including native Samsung Galaxy browsers.

title: The Telegraph
text: Sole Developer. Built a mini website for Fenwick and the Telegraph to act as an advent calendar counting down The 12 Days of Christmas.
